title: Vanderbilt Mansion National Historic Site: Calendar
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Calendar            Calendar        We're celebrating our birthday this month! You can too.  So just come on out and enjoy your parks! Photo-NPS       The Rightful Heritage of the People: Celebrating FDR's Conservation Legacy  Vanderbilt Mansion Visitor Center - Exhibit open everyday 9 AM to 5 PM. Every Kid in a Park Welcomes 4th Graders Through August 31, 2016, all National Parks  National Parks and some other federally managed sites in the Hudson Valley invite all fourth graders to visit free as part of the White House's new Every Kid in a Park program. Students may go to any NPS site or to www.everykidinapark.gov, complete an activity, and obtain a pass good through August 31, 2016. Music in the Parks, Free Lawn Concerts  August 3, 17, 24 Vanderbilt Mansion National Historic Site  Enjoy an evening of music, with friends, on beautiful lush landscapes, of the Vanderbilt and Mills Mansions, overlooking the Hudson River. Outdoor concerts begin at 7:00 pm in June and July. August concerts begin at 6:30 pm. Click here for full concert dates and times.  Arm-Of-The-Sea Theater Presents: Hook, Line & Sinker August 12, 3:00 - 4:00 PM, Home of FDR South Lawn   Arm-of-the-Sea Theater's production, Hook, Line & Sinker is a family-friendly performance featuring large-scale mask and puppet characters and live music in a unique presentation about the Hudson River. The play celebrates the timeless art of fishing, while offering advice about eating fish from the river.  More.... “Who's Protecting the acres of Forest, Water, Birds, and Wildlife Ecosystems at the Roosevelt-Vanderbilt National Historic Sites?“ August 13, 2:00 - 4:00 PM, Home of Franklin D. Roosevelt ( Wallace Visitor & Education Center) Join Northeast Temperate Network Park Science Communications Specialist Ed Sharron to learn about the most recent research studies on wildlife, plants and climate change in the Northeast Region National Parks.  Reserve your free tickets here.....  Hands In Dirt Workshops August 16, 9 am - Weeding; all workshops at Beatrix Farrand Garden at Bellefield  This series of workshops on gardening is offered throughout the year. Participants can practice techniques while they are learning. Presented by the Beatrix Farrand Garden Association.  Moonlight Night Hike  (SOLD OUT)  August 18, 8:30 - 10:30 PM, Vanderbilt Mansion National Historic Site Join Roosevelt-Vanderbilt National Historic Site for a Moonlight Night Hike with Park Ranger Susanne Norris the park Natural Resource Specialist. Come and explore the natural darkness on the grounds of the Vanderbilt Mansion National Historic Site.  For more information and to print your free tickets click here. NPS Centennial Founders Day Concert with West Point Military Academy Band August 24, 6:30 pm, Vanderbilt Mansion Celebrate our centennial with this popular lawn concert in front of the Vanderbilt Mansion. Rain date is August 25. More.... Post-Prohibition Celebration  August 26, 5:30-7:30 pm, South lawn of the FDR Home  In celebration of the National Park Service Centennial, Roosevelt-Vanderbilt Historical Association is pleased to host a Post-Prohibition Party on the South Lawn of Franklin D. Roosevelt's Home. This celebration will include period music by Big Band Sound, hors d'oeuvres, cocktails, and memories you will not forget! Dress to impress—period dress is encouraged, but not required. All proceeds from this event benefit the Roosevelt-Vanderbilt Historical Association which provides funding to Roosevelt-Vanderbilt National Historic Sites. Purchase Tickets here. Dr. Sarah Nelson's Lecture on Dragonfly-Mercury Research  September 10, 2:00 - 3:15 PM, Home of Franklin D. Roosevelt (Wallace Visitor & Education Center) Join Roosevelt-Vanderbilt NHS for a lecture by Dr. Sarah Nelson on the dragonfly research project. Researchers from the University of Maine, the US Geological Survey, and the National Park Service have been collecting dragonfly larvae in national parks across the US since 2012 -- including Roosevelt-Vanderbilt NHS.  Reserve your free tickets here... HIgh Tea in the Vanderbilt Formal Gardens September 11, 2 - 4 PM, Vanderbilt Mansion Formal Gardens   Enjoy an old fashioned tea with guest speaker and live music. Information at www.vanderbiltgarden.org Val-Kill Picnic & Square Dance September 17, 2 - 6 pm, Val-Kill   Visit the Eleanor Roosevelt Val-Kill Partnership for more information and to purchase tickets, www.valkill.org. Eleanor Roosevelt's Birthday & Gravesite Ceremony  October 11, 3 pm, Home of Franklin D. Roosevelt National Historic Site  Celebrate Eleanor Roosevelt's birthday with us. Remarks, followed by a wreath laying ceremony. Birthday Cake and beverages will be served in the Wallace Visitor Center at the conclusion of the ceremony.  Torchlight Parade  October 14, 7 pm, Henry A. Wallace Visitor and Education Center   Join us for this popular election-eve Torchlight parade re-enactment. The night will be filled with music, speeches, and a visit from FDR, Eleanor Roosevelt, their family and Fala.                   Keyword       By Date     Start Date      End Date          Search         Upcoming Events    Showing 3 results    Show ALL instances of recurring events   RSS Feed      Vanderbilt Mansion National Historic Site MUSIC IN THE PARKS      Time: 7:00 PM to 8:30 PM,6:30 PM to 8:00 PM Location: Staatsburgh State Historic Site (Mills Mansion) and Vanderbilt Mansion NHS Fees: Free     Wednesday, August 17, 2016 Free Lawn Concerts for 2016 View Details      Vanderbilt Mansion National Historic Site Moonlight Night Hike      Time: 8:30 PM to 10:30 PM Location: Vanderbilt Mansion National Historic Site Fees: Free     Thursday, August 18, 2016 Join Roosevelt-Vanderbilt NHS for a Moonlight Night Hike with Park Ranger Susanne Norris the park Natural Resource Specialist. Come and explore the natural darkness on the grounds of the Vanderbilt Mansion National Historic Site.
